title: MySQLSIGN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSIGN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the sign of a number:
SELECT SIGN(255.5);

Definition and Usage
The SIGN() function returns the sign of a number.
This function will return one of the following:
If number > 0, it returns 1
If number = 0, it returns 0
If number < 0, it returns -1
Syntax
SIGN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. The number to return the sign for
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the sign of a number:
SELECT SIGN(-12);

★
+1
